responses.content: Gemini 2.5 Pro is the latest frontier model, but the real momentum is how it powers Search, Cloud, Assistant, Android, and the Gemini app. AI Overviews now serves 1.5 billion monthly users, AI Mode doubles query depth, and Circle to Search runs on more than 250 million devices—delivering multimodal experiences while we keep the foundation of quality and trust.

Ironwood TPUs plus NVIDIA B200/B200 Blackwell GPUs give us compute leadership for training and inference. Lens visual searches grew by 5 billion queries since October, and Gemini Live camera and screen sharing are rolling out across Android devices. The investment in infrastructure enables both internal AI agents and customer-facing innovation.

Gemini 2.5 Flash, Imagen 3, Veo 2, and robotics/health models are all shipping quickly, and AI Studio usage is up more than 200% year-to-date. Our agent developer kit, Google Agent Space, and Duet AI copilots bring agentic workflows to enterprises, while products like NotebookLM show what smaller teams can ship.

philipp_schindler.role: Senior Vice President & Chief Business Officer

responses.content: AI Essentials, Project Astra, and PMAX automation help advertisers extract more value. Shorts monetization is improving with new ad formats, revenue sharing, and creator tools, while NFL Sunday Ticket and cultural moments like March Madness are driving brand engagement.

We increased capacity, grew the GCS channel, and offer Flex Credits/pay-as-you-go to lower experimentation friction. These moves, plus a renewed focus on deterministic agent workflows, fuel shorter create-and-close cycles for Data Cloud, Gemini, and AI-powered deals.

anat_ashkenazi.role: Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer

responses.content: Q1 generated $90.2B revenue, $34.5B net income, and $19B free cash flow. We raised the dividend 5% and authorized another $70B in buybacks because cash flow remains strong even as we invest roughly $75B in CapEx this year.

Cloud margin expansion to 17% reflects headcount management, procurement improvements, and targeted efficiency workstreams. Depreciation will rise as we absorb the CapEx step-up, but the focus remains on profitable growth while sustaining long-term infrastructure investment.

questions: Which AI innovations from Search or Gemini do you expect to drive durable, multi-year growth, and what are the key scaling constraints?
How do Google’s TPU advantages and infrastructure investments shape your CapEx cadence relative to other hyperscalers?
What is driving Shorts monetization progress and the resilience in direct response while macro uncertainty persists?
Will AI Overviews, AI Mode, and Gemini remain distinct experiences, and where are you seeing gross margin tailwinds beyond TAC and depreciation?
How are you pushing Gemini DAUs higher, and what is the tone of brand advertisers into Q2?
Do you still have enough efficiency levers to offset rising depreciation, and what optionality do you see for Waymo’s business model?

operating_environment_challenges: High infrastructure CapEx while maintaining efficiency
Advertiser mix shifts (Search/YouTube strength vs. Network pressure)
Macro uncertainty and geopolitical headwinds on ad spend
Managing depreciation growth from data center investments

new_cfo.name: Anat Ashkenazi
new_cfo.role: Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer
new_cfo.context: Transitioned into the CFO role with an emphasis on capital allocation and efficiency.
